# Introduction

In an increasingly geopolitical world, where tensions seem to be at an all-time high, countries are continually challenging both land and maritime boundaries. This complex and volatile landscape has led to a notable trend: an escalation in military spending across the globe. As nations vie for strategic advantages and seek to protect their interests, they are investing heavily in advanced defense technologies, modernizing their armed forces, and expanding their military capabilities. This surge in defense budgets reflects not only the pursuit of security and sovereignty but also the desire to exert influence and maintain competitive parity in a multipolar world. The implications of this trend are profound, affecting international relations, economic priorities, and the global balance of power. Understanding the drivers behind this increase in military expenditure is crucial to comprehending the broader dynamics shaping our contemporary geopolitical environment.[^1]

[^1]: For more details on specific military spending trends, refer to XYZ report, 2023.

# Strengths

-   The bubble chart visually represents the size of military spending across all countries, with larger bubble indicating a higher spending while providing additional spending value together with ranking allows for quick analysis.

-   Military spending as a share of GDP across all countries is represented using color coding, with lighter colors indicating lower percentage while brighter colors indicating higher percentage highlighting the severity of the country.
